questionText.en: Match the phrasal verbs from the sentences on the left with their definitions on the right.

label.en: to inspect for any faults, errors or defects
to force something into something else by hitting it
to restrict access using some kind of barrier
to raise using some kind of mechanic or hydraulic device
to support something or keep it from falling by placing something under or against it

feedbackCorrect.en: Excellent! All phrasal verbs are matched correctly.
feedbackCorrect.ar: ممتاز! تم مطابقة جميع الأفعال المركبة بشكل صحيح.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Not quite right. Check the pairings again. For example, 'pull down' means destroy, 'jack up' means raise.
feedbackIncorrect.ar: ليس صحيحاً تماماً. تحقق من الأزواج مرة أخرى. على سبيل المثال، 'pull down' يعني يدمر، و 'jack up' يعني يرفع.

supportContent.en: Fill in the gap using the correct preposition: to, from, off, into, onto, out of.

questionText.en: 1 My brother drove <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='prep1' placeholder='...'> Homs in one hour.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use 'to' to indicate the destination (Homs). Solution: to
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم 'to' للإشارة إلى الوجهة (حمص). الحل: to

supportContent.en: Fill in the gap using the correct preposition: to, from, off, into, onto, out of.

questionText.en: 2 The vase fell <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='prep2' placeholder='...'> the table and shattered on the floor.

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! 'off' indicates movement away from a surface.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! 'off' تشير إلى الحركة بعيداً عن سطح.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use 'off' to show movement away from a surface (the table). Solution: off
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم 'off' لإظهار الحركة بعيداً عن سطح (الطاولة). الحل: off

supportContent.en: Fill in the gap using the correct preposition: to, from, off, into, onto, out of.

questionText.en: 3 She suddenly turned and crashed <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='prep3' placeholder='...'> the fence.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use 'into' to show collision with something (the fence). Solution: into
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم 'into' لإظهار الاصطدام بشيء (السياج). الحل: into

supportContent.en: Fill in the gap using the correct preposition: to, from, off, into, onto, out of.

questionText.en: 4 What time does the flight <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='prep4' placeholder='...'> Cairo arrive?

supportContent.en: Fill in the gap using the correct preposition: to, from, off, into, onto, out of.

supportContent.en: Write what people think using 'have something done' and the words in brackets.

questionText.en:
Sign: LET US CLEAN YOUR CARPETS AND CURTAINS
Thought: (My mother goes to that shop. She/ the carpets/ clean/ there)
Sentence: My mother goes to that shop. She <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='causative8' placeholder='Causative phrase...'> there.

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! The context is present simple ('goes'), so use 'has the carpets cleaned'.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! السياق مضارع بسيط ('goes')، لذا استخدم 'has the carpets cleaned'.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use present simple causative: Subject (She) + has + object (the carpets) + past participle (cleaned). Solution: has the carpets cleaned
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم صيغة السببية في المضارع البسيط: فاعل (She) + has + مفعول به (the carpets) + اسم مفعول (cleaned). الحل: has the carpets cleaned

supportContent.en: Write what people think using 'have something done' and the words in brackets.

questionText.en:
Sign: WE MAKE KEYS OF ALL TYPES
Thought: (I’d almost forgotten. I/ ought to/ a new key/ make/ for the house)
Sentence: I’d almost forgotten. I <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='causative9' placeholder='Causative phrase...'> for the house.

causative9.en: ought to have a new key made

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! The structure uses the modal 'ought to' with the causative: 'ought to have a new key made'.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! البنية تستخدم الفعل المساعد 'ought to' مع صيغة السببية: 'ought to have a new key made'.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use modal causative: Subject (I) + ought to + have + object (a new key) + past participle (made). Solution: ought to have a new key made
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم صيغة السببية مع الفعل المساعد: فاعل (I) + ought to + have + مفعول به (a new key) + اسم مفعول (made). الحل: ought to have a new key made

supportContent.en: Write what people think using 'have something done' and the words in brackets.

questionText.en:
Sign: WE MEND WATCHES AND CLOCKS
Thought: (That shop isn’t expensive. I/ my watch/ mend/ there last week)
Sentence: That shop isn’t expensive. I <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='causative10' placeholder='Causative phrase...'> there last week.

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! The action happened 'last week', so use past simple causative 'had my watch mended'.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! الحدث وقع 'last week'، لذا استخدم صيغة السببية في الماضي البسيط 'had my watch mended'.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use past simple causative ('last week'): Subject (I) + had + object (my watch) + past participle (mended). Solution: had my watch mended
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم صيغة السببية في الماضي البسيط ('last week'): فاعل (I) + had + مفعول به (my watch) + اسم مفعول (mended). الحل: had my watch mended

supportContent.en: Write what people think using 'have something done' and the words in brackets.

questionText.en:
Sign: OUR SPECIALITY: PAINTING HOUSES AND FLATS
Thought: (I don’t think I can afford to/ our flat/ paint)
Sentence: I don’t think I can afford to <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='causative11' placeholder='Causative phrase...'>.

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! After 'afford to', we use the base form 'have', followed by the object and past participle: 'have our flat painted'.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! بعد 'afford to'، نستخدم الصيغة الأساسية 'have'، متبوعة بالمفعول به واسم المفعول: 'have our flat painted'.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. After 'afford to', use the base form of the causative structure: have + object (our flat) + past participle (painted). Solution: have our flat painted
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. بعد 'afford to'، استخدم الصيغة الأساسية لبنية السببية: have + مفعول به (our flat) + اسم مفعول (painted). الحل: have our flat painted

supportContent.en: Use 'had something done' to describe the unpleasant event.

questionText.en:
Event: (Ali’s driving licence was taken away by the police.)
Sentence: Ali <input type='text' class='fill-blank-input' data-blank-id='causative12' placeholder='Causative phrase...'>.

causative12.en: had his driving licence taken away

feedbackCorrect.en: Correct! The past event 'was taken' becomes 'had his driving licence taken away'.
feedbackCorrect.ar: صحيح! الحدث الماضي 'was taken' يصبح 'had his driving licence taken away'.

feedbackIncorrect.en: Incorrect. Use past simple causative for the past event: Subject (Ali) + had + object (his driving licence) + past participle phrase (taken away). Solution: had his driving licence taken away
feedbackIncorrect.ar: خطأ. استخدم صيغة السببية في الماضي البسيط للحدث الماضي: فاعل (Ali) + had + مفعول به (his driving licence) + عبارة اسم المفعول (taken away). الحل: had his driving licence taken away
